RoleContent: Humph, I'll let you off this time. Let's go!

Title: Danger approaches

RoleContent: Such behavior will never be tolerated by the Commune.
Name: Attack
Title: Danger approaches
TitleContent: Garrison Point Defense Points -1 if left unresolved for 2 days.
Desc: Despite the Commune's shortage of supplies, Tatyana and the members refuse to tolerate such crimes. After a fierce fight, they successfully drive off the thieves, recover the lost supplies, and celebrate their victory.

RoleContent: Dangerous hostile enemy may be present ahead. Enter with extreme caution.

RoleContent: I'm sure everyone is well aware of the current situation in New Sophiasburgh...
TitleContent: After burying the unidentified Corrupted, Antonov gathers the key members of the Border Commune for a quick yet important meeting in New Sophiasburgh.
UnOpenDesc: Unopened.

RoleContent: Freedom does not mean carelessness, and having no restrictions does not mean we can go without planning for the future.
UnOpenDesc: Unopened.

RoleContent: But now, the fear of intruders, the desire to conquer this desolate land, and the hatred for the Narwhals are sweeping through the city. We need to find a way to resolve these conflicts.
UnOpenDesc: Unopened.

TitleContent: The future that emerges in your mind while you stare at the blank sheet of paper is...
Desc: Please think carefully and write down suggestions that will help improve this city of ideals.
UnOpenDesc: Unopened.

RoleContent: Thank you all for your wisdom and insight. I believe this city will have a better future with your care and hard work.
TitleContent: Carefully write down your thoughts on the issue, and place the letter into the feedback box.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: While patrolling near the snowy forest, they spot a few wandering Corrupted, heading towards the camp's stables.\n\nMost of these horses are descendants of warhorses brought from New Sophiasburgh. They are seasoned warriors that have been with the Commune along the Ice Sea's edge for many years.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: The patrol team eliminates the Corrupted on the road. When they return to camp a warhorse is reported to have gone missing from the stables.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: The missing warhorse "Ryne" arrived here with the pioneers. It is highly obedient and served for years without any records of escape.\n\nConfused, the group leaves the stables.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: Due to time constraints, the patrol team quickly drives the Corrupted away, sending them on a different path.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

RoleContent: Why didn't you show up earlier? I thought you...
Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: A warhorse jumps out from the forest, giddily circling the people. Soon, people realize it's "Ryne", the warhorse that went missing weeks ago.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

RoleContent: No, Ryne, you did great. I knew you'd find your way home—because you never really left.
Name: Ryne the Warhorse
Title: Ryne the Warhorse
Desc: Ryne lets out an excited cry. I looks like it went on an epic adventure, but no one would ever know.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse II
Title: Ryne the Warhorse II
Desc: During another patrol, a shadow leaps from the trees, charging at the team.\n\n"Ryne?!" In the chaos, the shadow freezes at the shout. The team catches a glimpse of their intelligent warhorse, now covered in rotting wounds, its eyes wild with madness.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse II
Title: Ryne the Warhorse II
Desc: Fight the Enemy "the Corrupted Ryne"
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

RoleContent: If we had killed off the Corrupted when we passed by the stables, maybe none of this would have happened...
Name: Ryne the Warhorse II
Title: Ryne the Warhorse II
Desc: The team puts up a small tombstone for the dead "Ryne", honoring all that it had sacrificed for the camp.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: Ryne the Warhorse II
Title: Ryne the Warhorse II
Desc: Traditionally, the locals would eat fallen warhorses, but this time, they decide to give "Ryne" a proper burial because it is Corrupted, and nobody wishes to desecrate its body.\n\nNow, it will rest peacefully in the embrace of the snowy wind, with the blessings of its comrades.
UnOpenDesc: It is your most loyal companion.

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: While patrolling the camp's edge, you notice that the heating system has caused the permafrost to melt, loosening the soil and making it suitable for planting.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: The Commune is sending someone to loosen the soil, so this area should turn into a farm soon.\nCome back to check on it later.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

RoleContent: You are so selfish!\nYou were the one who wanted to move here, but now you don't want be here to grow potatoes?
Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: It's been a while since people loosened the soil outside the camp. It's time to check how that's going.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

RoleContent: You think I don't know? I know you just want to go back to those carefree days!\nWhy else would you have played Katyusha that day?
Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: They seem to be arguing about something.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: It sounds like two members are arguing by the farm, but since you only heard part of the conversation, the argument is not making much sense.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

RoleContent: I know... those happy days are gone for good...\nI do want to stay here with you for the rest of my life, to create a new future together!
Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: Tatyana knows better than to stick her nose into other people's business, but she can't just let them continue arguing. So, Tatyana steps in to mediate.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

RoleContent: ...I'm so sorry, I shouldn't have said those things...
Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: Tatyana knows better than to stick her nose into other people's business, but she can't just let them continue arguing. So, Tatyana steps in to mediate.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: With Tatyana's empathic intervention, the squabblers quickly make up before hugging and apologizing in tears.\n\nThe conflict was sudden and the cause unclear, but all's well that ends well.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: After some thought, Tatyana decides it's best not to get involved as an outsider.\n\nShe shakes her head and gets ready to leave, when she suddenly hears a heavy object hit the snow behind her.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

RoleContent: Forget it, I... I never liked growing potatoes with you anyway!
Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: One of the woman throws her hoe into the mountains, while the other covers her face and runs off in tears.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: The Shadow of Winter
Title: The Shadow of Winter
Desc: Will have to wait for another chance in the future to talk to them and help resolve their conflict.
UnOpenDesc: Why are you playing Katyusha!

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc:
While exploring a ruin, the team finds a strange Old World Glyph on a wall:

"Traps ahead. Raise your hands and praise the Ice Sea to pass.
—From Stoneville."
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: The Glyph looks worn and old, and the narrow path ahead has traces of both old and recent battles. The traps are probably real... but can you really trust this strange advice?
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: For the safety of the team, Tatyana decides to lead them around the ruin.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

RoleContent: What's going on? This strange mechanism definitely defies the laws of physics...
Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: The team decides to risk going through the wall, but rocks begin to fall continuously after they take just a few steps, as if telling them to stop.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

RoleContent: Ahem, um... should we... praise the Ice Sea?
Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc:
Tatyana reluctantly decides to try the strange advice.

...
After completing the ritual, a peculiar sound echoes from deep within the ruin, and a hidden passage slowly appears in a secluded corner.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc:
Welcome, visitor #1882. I am the Observer of this ruin. You may choose to keep or permanently erase the clue. I will respect your decision.

Do you wish to erase the hint:

"Traps ahead. Raise your hands and praise the Ice Sea to pass.
—From Stoneville."
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

RoleContent: Why would we erase the hint?
Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: Tatyana asks for a logical reason.\nThe strange voice replies,\n"Because there are all kinds of people in this world—some might even take pleasure in the deaths of those who come after."
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

RoleContent: ...Please keep the hint as it is.
Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc:
Understood. You have made the same choice as the 1881 travelers before you.

"Hmm... Esteemed visitors, your actions and logic intrigue me. I find myself drawn to the possibilities you bring."

"Would you be willing to help me with a small trial? Please check out this location."

"Rest assured, the reward will be well worth your effort."
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: A set of coordinates soon appears on the ground. Tatyana checks to find that the location lies <color=#FF5826>southwest</color> from here.\n\nShe records the information and leaves the ruins with the team.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: A set of coordinates soon appears on the ground. Tatyana checks to find that the location lies <color=#FF5826>northwest</color> from here.\n\nShe records the information and leaves the ruins with the team.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: There's a trap in front.
Title: There's a trap in front.
Desc: A set of coordinates soon appears on the ground. Tatyana checks to find that the location lies <color=#FF5826>northeast</color> from here.\n\nShe records the information and leaves the ruins with the team.
UnOpenDesc: Please examine the Glyph on the wall carefully.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: During a ruin exploration, the team gets trapped in an abandoned war room by the Corrupted. In the chaos, someone finds a yellowed note on an old control panel.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: To those who come after, I have left just enough energy to activate the turret once. Once you press this button, the turret will eliminate all your enemies and shutdown permanently. I hope this will help you survive.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: Once you press the button, the turret fires a burst of high-energy beam, burning up all the Corrupted around the war room.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: After making sure the area is clear, you open the door—only to be shocked by what you see. There's a vast living space, filled with traces that suggest someone lived here for a long time.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: The deer bones piled in the corner, tattered cloth hanging from the beams, and torn fishing net drifting in the water—are all traces of someone's desperate struggle for survival.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: As you open the file cabinet that has fallen apart in the corner, the farewell letters they left behind have traveled through time and space and appeared in front of you.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: We've been fighting the Punishing for three years, and we're completely out of food. All the animals are infected... There's no point in struggling anymore. It's time to leave the last sliver of hope for those who come after us.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: Our death may be meaningless, but if it can be turned into hope for those who come after, that would give our lives meaning.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: Farewell, the sunrise over the snowy Mt. Green-Vanos. Farewell, the boundless Kyaranta Ice Sea. Farewell, guardians who roam beneath the auroras. May I be blessed to return to you as a snowflake in my next life.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Final Defense
Title: Final Defense
Desc: The team decides not to press the button since nobody knows if this old thing still works or if it's a trap.
UnOpenDesc: I choose to leave the final hope to you.

Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: On their way back, the patrol team enters a ruin of an ancient city gate, a place they're familiar with because it's on their patrol route.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

RoleContent: This is strange. This wall... was it here before?
Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: Strangely, this time everyone gets lost. No matter which way they go, they are stuck inside the maze of high walls and towers.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

RoleContent: Wait, wait! Ah—!
Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: Tatyana tries to push the snow-covered wall, and to her surprise, it grips onto her arm as if its alive and pulls her forward.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

RoleContent: That wall sure likes to send people to weird places... Hm, I should look around now that I'm separated from the team.
Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: The familiar snowfields and tundra are replaced by a desolate ruin.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

RoleContent: Thank you for finding me. I'll leave everything in here to you. See ya! I'm going to keep looking for my parents!
Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: After opening the chest deep within the high walls, the fog in the ruins slowly lifts, and a child's voice, crisp and melodic like a silver bell, echoes between the walls.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: The thick fog clears, and Tatyana tries to talk to the voice, but hears no reply.\n\nWhen she meets up with the team, they report finding a clean doll amidst the ruin. Its looked starkly out of place in the surrounding devastation.
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

Name: Hide-and-seek
Title: Hide-and-seek
Desc: Take the doll and flip it over to find a row of childish handwriting on its back: "Mommy and Daddy, I love you forever. Alina."
UnOpenDesc: She Was Here Once

Name: Abandoned Facility
Title: Abandoned Facility
Desc: You find an abandoned armory, filled with mountains of weapons that once symbolized power and victory, now rusting and forgotten.
UnOpenDesc: Remnants of the Old World

Name: Abandoned Facility
Title: Abandoned Facility
Desc: After a thorough inspection, you discover that the armory has two security doors, connected by a clever mechanism. One door can only be opened by explosives, but once detonated, the other will be blocked by falling rocks.
UnOpenDesc: Remnants of the Old World

RoleContent: Intel report! We found a new passage ahead!
Name: Abandoned Facility
Title: Abandoned Facility
Desc: You blow open the door on the left to find a dark circular passage that seems to lead to another world.
UnOpenDesc: Remnants of the Old World

Name: Abandoned Facility
Title: Abandoned Facility
Desc: You blow up the door on the right, only to find another solid wall behind it. After a brief check with no progress, you return with the rest of the supplies in the armory.
UnOpenDesc: Remnants of the Old World

Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: After exploring deep into the cave, your flashlight reveals a row of hastily written, large, messy letters on the iron door:\n\n"Turn back now, or you'll die!"
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: The warning feels ominous, so the group decides to avoid the risks and return with the rest of the supplies in the armory.
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

RoleContent: Intruders... detected... Initiating... elimination.
Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: As you step into the darkness, it looks like nothing lies beyond the door. But soon, a strange vibration ahead causes you to lose your footing.\n\nHeavy, time-worn Mechanoid Guards awaken from the dark corners, moving toward the "intruders" with weapons of slaughter.
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: As you step into the darkness, it looks like nothing lies beyond the door. But soon, a strange vibration ahead causes you to lose your footing.\n\nHeavy, time-worn Mechanoid Guards awaken from the dark corners, moving toward the "intruders" with weapons of slaughter.
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: Please... do not... take the weapons... outside...\n"This land... can no longer... withstand war..."\nThe Mechanoid Guard's final words are cut short as it runs out of energy and shuts down.
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

RoleContent: The manager of this armory must have a twisted personality.
Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: After searching, the group finds a mark on the Mechanoid Guard. It is the emblem of a northern kingdom that fell in the civil war.\n\n"They are killing everyone who enters just because they don't want to start another war?"
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

Name: Loyal Guard
Title: Loyal Guard
Desc: Don't worry, I'll prove to you that we won't abuse this power. We'll use it to protect us.\nBut this short message will never reach the owner of the Mechanoid.
UnOpenDesc: I remember, I obey.

Name: To the Battlefield
Title: To the Battlefield
Desc: Reports of "Yeti" sightings in the snowy forest near the camp come in. While investigations show it's only a brown bear covered in snow, many polar natives, driven by their hunting spirit, are eager to take down the "Yeti" on their own.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: You're asking for trouble.
Name: To the Battlefield
Title: To the Battlefield
Desc: After failing to dissuade the crowd, Tatyana reluctantly agrees for them to take turns fighting the bear. Everyone in the Commune gets excited, eager to be the first to defeat the "Yeti."
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: No Match For It
Name: To the Battlefield
Title: To the Battlefield
Desc: Rob returns, defeated, with a little bit of goods a few days later. He says he was no match for the powerful bear.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: I want to fight again next time!
Name: To the Battlefield
Title: To the Battlefield
Desc: Alexei returns, defeated, a few days later. He says he was no match for the powerful bear, but the fight helped him improve his combat skills significantly.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: I will win for sure next time!
Name: To the Battlefield II
Title: To the Battlefield II
Desc: After a while, talk of the "Yeti" lurking in the snowy forest resurfaces. The fighters are once again eager to take on the bear as revenge for their defeated comrades.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: Let me fight it! I'm ready! I am so done with all the bureaucracy here!
Name: To the Battlefield II
Title: To the Battlefield II
Desc: Tatyana decides it's time to end this ridiculous competition—sending more people out is pointless. The crowd is reluctant, but they eventually accepted defeat by the bear.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: It's too strong... We can't win...
Name: To the Battlefield II
Title: To the Battlefield II
Desc: The Commune sends plumber George to fight the Yeti, but he returns defeated after a few days. "Sorry," George says, "it's too strong. I couldn't even give it a good fight."
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: We should win, right?
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: The Commune's fixation on the Yeti has turned into a ridiculous obsession. Tatyana declares that she will personally hunt down the bear herself next time.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: Is it finally my turn to fight the Yeti? I am so ready!
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: On the day of the final battle, half the Commune gathers by the snowy forest, eager to see what fate awaits the last challenger—Artur.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: Tch, this is exactly why I keep saying we need to keep it down...!
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: Just before the final showdown a swarm of Corrupted suddenly appear from the snowy forest and surround the onlookers.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: But we won in the end!!
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: After the skirmish, they discover the corpse of the brown bear that had been the center of attention for so long. Its death went completely unnoticed.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: I told you, this is simple. This could have been solved long ago if we had sent out more people!
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: Arthur: "How can it... end like this? Then what was the point of my obsession?"
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

RoleContent: ...Do whatever you want, just don't do it again.
Name: To the Battlefield III
Title: To the Battlefield III
Desc: In the end, they decide to split the bear's teeth and fur evenly and share credit for slaying the Yeti.
UnOpenDesc: No time for... departure...

Name: Big Cleanup
Title: Big Cleanup
Desc: The weather is nice today, so everyone decides to stay in camp and thoroughly clean the makeshift buildings.
UnOpenDesc: The Commune is My Home

RoleContent: I mean, we might as well take this chance to tear down some buildings that are blocking the road.
Name: Big Cleanup
Title: Big Cleanup
Desc: The camp's buildings vary in style and materials. Some are made from disassembled ship parts, but most are built with whatever was available. This makes cleaning them very tricky.
UnOpenDesc: The Commune is My Home

RoleContent: We'll clean up the area ahead another time.
Name: Big Cleanup
Title: Big Cleanup
Desc: The cleanup is taking a lot of time, and with so much waste piling up around the camp, cleaning up from the outside in proves ineffective.
UnOpenDesc: The Commune is My Home

Name: Big Cleanup
Title: Big Cleanup
Desc: They start clearing construction waste blocking the road from the center of the camp, opening up a path wide enough for a carriage.\n\nThey even find useful supplies hidden in corners during the process.
UnOpenDesc: The Commune is My Home

RoleContent: Potatoes, canned tomatoes, firewood... Hey! Who chucked this snapped hoe here? This isn't a trash yard!
Name: Big Cleanup
Title: Big Cleanup
Desc: Soon, the road is clean and tidy again, but they'll need to check the area regularly to stop more illegal littering.
UnOpenDesc: The Commune is My Home

Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: A patrol trekking across the tundra spots an unfamiliar distress signal. They rush to the source and find a Kyarantian trapped in an ice cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Please... I'll do anything for you for the rest of my life if you can save me!
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: Shock and guilt appears on his face the moment he realizes he's speaking to Commune members—he knows very well what the Kyarantians had done to the Border Commune.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: The patrol members' expressions vary, but most look indifferent.\n\nThe Kyarantian's leg wound reeks of infection. Even if they bring him back, he probably won't live long.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: I'm sorry, but we can't take in another person—we'd be putting ourselves at risk. Here's some food and fuel. We hope you make it until the next rescue team comes...
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: The light that glimmered briefly in the man's eyes fades once more. But he falls silent and gratefully accepts the supplies.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Thank you very much for helping me—I'm deeply grateful.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: The light that glimmered briefly in the man's eyes fades once more. But he falls silent and gratefully accepts the supplies.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: I'm sorry, but we can't take in another person—we'd be putting ourselves at risk. Here's some food and fuel. We hope you make it until the next rescue team comes...
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: No one responds. Everyone watches as the man's movements slow before he finally collapses in the icy cave and stops moving completely.\n\n"Maybe we could've saved him if we'd arrived sooner." Someone mutters softly as they leave and shuts off the signal transmitter the man left behind.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: This snow cave is too deep, and we don't have the right gear to pull you out.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: The group moves closer to assess the size of the cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: I-I brought a device called "Evening Bell Type X". I must have dropped it by the cave when I fell. It can secure climbing ropes. Please, if you can find it, I can get out!
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: The group moves closer to assess the size of the cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Okay, let me see if I can find it.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: Tatyana assigns one person to look after the injured man and follows the collapsed snow trail to look for the lost device.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Okay, let me see if I can find it.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: Tatyana assigns one person to look after the injured man and follows the collapsed snow trail to look for the lost device.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Take him back and notify the people at Port Kyaranta to pick him up once he recovers.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: With the help of the "Evening Bell Type X", the frail man is pulled from the snow cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: ...Thank you all so much! I will report this to the governor and make sure you all get a proper reward.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: With the help of the "Evening Bell Type X", the frail man is pulled from the snow cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Thank you all so much, kind strangers!
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: With the help of the "Evening Bell Type X", the frail man is pulled from the snow cave.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: No need to thank me. I didn't save you because you're Kyarantian, and you don't owe us anything. This is also what sets us apart.
Name: Friends
Title: Friends
Desc: Tatyana turns her head, pressing her lips tight, her tone cold and firm.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Evening Bell
Title: Evening Bell
Desc: Tatyana follows the avalanche trail and finds an alloy device in the snow a few dozen steps away.\n\nThe "Evening Bell Type X" looks nothing like a typical tool—it looks more like a bionic creature than a machine.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Hello, strangers. How can I help you?
Name: Evening Bell
Title: Evening Bell
Desc: After pressing the power button, it activates.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Ahem, your master... is trapped in a snow cave. Can you come with me to rescue him?
Name: Evening Bell
Title: Evening Bell
Desc: After pressing the power button, it activates.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Sure! I'd be delighted. However, I do not have the navigation data for this area since I was made in Port Kyaranta, so can you guide me with this leash?
Name: Evening Bell
Title: Evening Bell
Desc: The Evening Bell Type X releases a tether.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: ...This feeling... it's almost like walking a sled dog.
Name: Evening Bell
Title: Evening Bell
Desc: The Evening Bell Type X releases a tether.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: As the patrol team passes an Old World sentry fort, they accidentally trigger an alarm. A massive Robo Worm from the Golden Age breaks out from the frozen ground, chasing after them.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: Fight the Robo Worm!
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: After a tough battle, the group finally defeats the Robo Worm.\n\nA mechanic checks its memory and finds that a shutdown command was issued recently, but due to system error, the command was never executed.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: Its event log suggests someone tried to shut it down, fearing the ancient machine might accidentally harm someone. But it's clear their efforts were in vain.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Quick! Activate the device I brought with me.
Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: In the heat of battle, a man who looks familiar arrives in a vehicle. He kicks up a blizzard using the breaks to temporarily block the Robo Worm's vision, buying the patrol team valuable time.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: Fight the Robo Worm!
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: I couldn't introduce myself earlier—I'm Tarek, an engineer from Port Kyaranta. I'm here to permanently disable the alarm at this fortress. Thanks for saving my life out there last time.
Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: After a tough battle, the group manages to beat the Robo Worm with the help of the "Evening Bell Type X."
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: What a coincidence. I brought the "Evening Bell Type X" here to deal with this Worm, but you ended up drawing it out first.
Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: The group watches in fear at his slender figure and the pile of Robo Worm remains.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

RoleContent: Anyway, thanks for your help. Farewell, my friends—I need to head to the next fort to deactivate the alarm.
Name: Robo Worm
Title: Robo Worm
Desc: Tarek waves goodbye and sets off on another journey with his "Evening Bell Type X" toward the icefield in the other direction.
UnOpenDesc: Goodbye! I'll see you next time!

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: Recently, a group of traitors within the camp has been stealing supplies from the Border Commune with careful planning. Their lack of productivity and habit of plundering food has caused significant disruption to public order.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: I guess it's game on! We'll get to the bottom of it after teaching them a lesson!
Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: The patrol team finds this spot after following the tracks of the traitors in the snow. The moment the groups meet, the traitors attack without a word, determined to simply silence anyone who has found them.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: 没办法，只能开打了，把他们都收拾一顿之后再问出原委吧！
Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: 为了追捕他们，巡逻队追溯着雪地上留下的马蹄印来到了此处。彼此一会面，还没有任何交流，对方便不由分说地向社员们袭击了过来，看来是铁了心拒绝沟通，誓要置追踪他们的人于死地。
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: The defeated traitors are tied up for questioning, but they angrily reveal everything before the interrogation even begins.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc:
Traitor A:
"Humph! You are the traitors of this land. We trusted you, yet you chose to side with wolves? Traitors like you have no right to judge us!"

Traitor B:
"Have you forgotten about Kyaranta? Border Commune was supposed to bring us justice make them pay... But instead, you accept them all and even bring them into our homeland?"

Traitor C:
"That's why we part ways with you, so we can get the revenge we want... What's wrong with that?"
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: The members fall silent. These people's hatred stems from a past long gone. It's not something a few words can heal. Only if time is reversed, rotten wood turns green again, and their loved ones return, can the scars in their hearts heal.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: We have not forgotten... But does robbing your own people solve the problem? Aren't you just hiding behind your twisted sense of justice to do the same things they did?\n\n"If you don't want to return to the Border Commune, then leave. Your safety will no longer be my concern, and I won't see you as one of us. Go, and if I catch you again, I will show no mercy."
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: The traitors look stunned. They have never thought about it this way. When Tatyana cuts loose their ropes, they quickly scramble out of sight.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: None of these justifies hurting one of your own. Bring them back. I have no right to judge you, so let the people in the camp decide your fate.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home
Title: Our Home
Desc: The members bring the traitors back to the camp, where the entire camp decides their fate together.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: Yo, look! It's the wimps of the Border Commune, the turncoat, and the lapdogs of the Arctic Route Union. You sent my brothers running a few days ago—now it's time for you to pay!
Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: A band of rebels jump out from their ambush in the snowy forest, blocking the Commune patrol team. Their leader is arrogant, yet the group is disciplined and their roles well-defined. Even as parasites leeching off others, they have a strict internal structure.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: Calm down.
Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc:
Looking at the rebels, Tatyana attempts to negotiate:

"Let's put down our weapons. This conflict can be solved without blood."

"Besides, you can't survive on stolen goods forever. When winter arrives, your shelters will freeze into ice caves, and I'll be able to get rid of you without dirtying my hands."
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: The rebel leader smirks.\n"You've certainly worked hard for this camp... but don't you forget, we don't need our enemy's mercy. We will not let go of our hatred just to survive!"\n"Since those young lads couldn't keep their cool and exposed themselves, we don't no need to hide anymore. Today, I'll send you traitors on your way!"
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: In that case, I have no mercy left for traitors like you!
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: Right back at you! You're no less of a traitor from our perspective!
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: 对我们说这些狠话可没用，从我们的立场上看来，你又何尝不是一个叛徒！
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: It was a difficult battle, but the Commune overpowers the rebels in the end. Once the leader realizes it's over for him, he takes his own life by leaping off a cliff. After the battle, the team sorts through the stolen supplies from the rebel stronghold, where they find a torn letter tucked in a diary. "I will never forgive them. The hatred born from that atrocity must burn on, even if I'll become a devil just like them. Isa, I'm already in hell. I don't wish for you to wait for me in heaven, but please watch over me until the very end."
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: Stay on guard! They might have a backup!
Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: At Tatyana's command, the Commune members move into formation, ready for battle.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: 谨慎迎战，他们也许还留有后手！
Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: 在塔季扬娜一声令下后，公社成员开始调整阵型，准备迎战。
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: After a fierce clash, the rebel leader senses his enemies are holding back and halts the fight. He then questions the Commune's intentions. Tatyana explains that she refuses to spill the blood of her own people and seeks a peaceful resolution.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: The rebel leader pauses at Tatyana's words for a moment before shouting,\n"Do you always think about such meaningless things in life-or-death situations like this? ...Never mind, you're at least better than the bastards from Kyaranta."\n"...I'll trust you one last time. Take them—these are all my weapons. No tricks, no traps. We barely got anything out of the camp to begin with—this raid was also a big gamble for us."
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

RoleContent: ...Thank you for trusting us.
Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: The rebels hesitate but follow their leader's order in the end. They put up their hands and lay down their weapons.
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Our Home II
Title: Our Home II
Desc: While he is being cuffed and led away, the leader whispers as he passes by Tatyana,\n"Don't get me wrong—I am just trying to save my people. I hope you won't end up regretting your decision one day, like I did."
UnOpenDesc: The Faraway Lands

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: The team discovers an abandoned village during their patrol.\n\nIt looks abandoned before the Punishing outbreak. There are plenty of supplies, yet the residents vanished without a trace, leaving even valuable belongings behind.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Thick dust on the supplies hints that the village has been abandoned for decades. The group decides to collect the valuable tools\n\nand finds an exquisite gold ring that looks as good as new. It gleams with a mesmerizing light, stirring a deep desire to possess it.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Gold and silver are useless in this wasteland. It would be more practical to carry more tools, so the group puts the mysterious ring back into the drawer.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Tatyana picks up the ring and slips it onto her finger as if possessed by a mysterious force.\n\nAs the ring fits onto her finger, an overwhelming sense of satisfaction fills her—like the ring was always meant to be hers.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Tatyana immediately realizes how dangerous her thoughts are—this obsession could sow friction within the team,\n\nso she removes the ring and tucks it into a cloth bag.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Gold and silver may be useless right now, but they might be exchanged for supplies later. With that in mind, Tatyana takes the ring with her.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

RoleContent: Humans, you have taken what doesn't belong to you. The living do not deserve to possess it.
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: A sudden blizzard obscures the view, and through the blinding storm, a tall knight in black slowly approaches from the far side of the frozen lake.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

RoleContent: In Chernobog's name, I command you to return the treasure, and thus the blizzard of disaster shall fade in time.
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: He rides a sleek, pitch-black steed, wearing a heavy helmet that conceals his face.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

RoleContent: Children of mankind, your will is truly admirable. To reward your courage, I will grant you what you deserve.
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Following his instructions, Tatyana places the ring on the ice lake and walks away, her back turned to the knight.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: As the voice fades, the storm over the tundra instantly clears, and a bright sky appears over the frozen lake.\n\nThe group turns to look— the ring is gone, and only a trail of hoofprints remain in the snow.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

RoleContent: Whatever, hesitation is a privilege of mankind. I hope you will make the right choice before the real tragedy strikes.
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: The people gave no answer, but the knight shows no impatience.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: The knight's dark figure vanishes into the snowstorm, which gradually begins to clear.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

ConfirmContent: We can't go on like this.
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: In the days after the ring was brought back to camp, several conflicts break out, all caused by the mysterious ring.\n\nThose involved in the conflict seem mesmerized by the ring's golden glow, and become obsessed with it. They neglect their duties and sink deeper into endless conflict.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Others who don't want the ring are also deeply troubled by it and feel mentally drained.\n\nTo stop the conflict, they plead with Tatyana to destroy it for the sake of the camp.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Tatyana throws the ring into the furnace in front of everyone, ending all the conflicts.\n\nSome were sad they could not possess it, but most know this is the right decision that will bring back peace.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Faced with the two choices, the rivals unexpectedly set aside their differences and oppose destroying the ring in unison, so the proposal is put on hold.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: A member reports that a traitor, who had been eyeing the golden ring for a while, knocked out the guard and fled with the ring and other valuables last night.\n\nWhat puzzled everyone is that the ring can't give him a shelter or help him survive, so he may very well die in the cold, frozen wasteland with his treasure.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Everyone talks about the incident. Many believed that "he was an honest man who was tempted by the ring to do something foolish."\n\nThough the ring and the chaos it brought are gone, doubt and suspicion lingered in the camp for a long time.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: After navigating the ruins, twisting, turning and breaking down walls, they find an old supply box deep within.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: Be careful, we've seen these before. They look like ordinary supply boxes, but 99.99% of them are traps. People call them "Treasure Chest Monsters".
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: The box bears the emblem of a long-dead northern kingdom. It feels heavy and is probably filled with supplies from the Old World.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: Wait, this box... oh no, it's a trap!
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: As Tatyana opens the crate, two mechanical steel hands grab her to drag her in.\n\nAlarms blare inside the ruins as security mechanoids appear and charge toward the group.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: 等等，这个箱子是……糟糕，中陷阱了！
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: As Tatyana opens the crate, two mechanical steel hands grab her to drag her in.\n\nAlarms blare inside the ruins as security mechanoids appear and charge toward the group.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: Gosh... I even warned that the box was a trap, but we still fell for it.
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: Wait, I think there's something inside this box.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: Food? Wait, there's blood... I get it. These boxes are traps that use food as bait to lure in teams desperate for supplies.
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: Tatyana lifts and flips over the box to reveal moldy wheat stained with blood at the bottom.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: What a waste, all this food that could've filled our stomachs...
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: Tatyana lifts and flips over the box to reveal moldy wheat stained with blood at the bottom.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

RoleContent: They were already in a brutal war, yet instead of giving food to those in need, they squandered it... This must be the reason for their downfall.
Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: Surprised by the truth behind the infamous "Treasure Chest Monster", Diana and the Forest Guards fall silent.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

Name: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Title: Legacy of the Old Kingdom
Desc: Diana's warning sounds reasonable. It is odd for a treasure chest to appear in this wasteland, \n\nso the group ignores it and moves on.
UnOpenDesc: Treasure? Or a trap?

Name: Hidden Mechanism
Title: Hidden Mechanism
Desc: The facility is filled with various old instruments, with an activation device at the center. Pressing it will reveal the research station's secrets.
UnOpenDesc: The forgotten building opens the path forward.

Name: Hidden Mechanism
Title: Hidden Mechanism
Desc: The entire room starts to shake as the lights on the walls flicker eerily.\n\nA loud rumble follows, as if a massive machine is starting up.
UnOpenDesc: The forgotten building opens the path forward.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: As the city anxiously anticipates a potential crisis, a representative from the Arctic Route Union arrives with an urgent request concerning the safety of all in the polar region.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: ...In short, victims of the Amberia incident are fleeing here, and this will soon affect the entire polar region and New Sophiasburgh. For all of our safety, we urge you to join this campaign.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: Once New Sophiasburgh began to grow rapidly, it became a key trade port for and maintained close ties with the Arctic Route Union. However, this is the first time they are negotiating a matter of such importance.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: ...Thank you for your support. Let's protect this land together and give it the peace it deserves.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: Even the most battle-hardened settlers fall silent at the request.\n\nAfter careful consideration, some step forward to form a strike team to defend New Sophiasburgh and hunt down the rogue Construct.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: I know what you seek... If you're willing to pay the price, I will give you the key to the right door.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Strange Merchant
Desc: The merchant isn't from around here. Her delicate appearance seems out of place in the eerie ruins.\n\nBut with no other leads on the rogue Construct, trusting her may be the only choice.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: She looks a little familiar... But never mind that. Ignoring her now wouldn't be wise. We need to use every lead we have.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Strange Merchant
Desc: The white-haired merchant girl waits silently in the depths of the ruins.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: Congratulations, now you have the "perfect opportunity". Make this blessing count... and choose wisely.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Strange Merchant
Desc: The white-haired merchant girl waits silently in the depths of the ruins.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: The maze-like paths quickly disorient the group. Something with "coordinates" should help guide them out.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: As they approach a door, the data box from the merchant suddenly flashes a brief but intense red light, as if trying to warn its holder.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: The winding paths of the ruins quickly disorient the group. A "precise coordinate" should help guide them in the right direction.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: This Construct must be the "victim" Staessen mentioned...
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: The rogue Construct wanders the depths of the ruins, wailing for a response that will never come.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: The rogue Construct wanders the depths of the ruins, wailing for a response that will never come.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

RoleContent: It makes me sad too, but let's end this quickly to give her peace.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Visitor from the Arctic Route Union
Desc: The rogue Construct wanders the depths of the ruins, wailing for a response that will never come.
UnOpenDesc: That tragedy is far from over.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: As the entire city trembles at the thought of the Narwhal attacking the port, the Border Commune begins working with the Forest Guard to \n\nbuild a lighthouse and walls along the city's edge, keeping watch over the Narwhal's every move.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: Forest Guard declares that New Sophiasburgh is safe from a sudden Corrupted attack under their watch. This promise eases many people's fears.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: As the lighthouse nears completion, the silver tower rises from the earth, making the city look ever more indestructible.\n\nNear New Sophiasburgh lies the ruined fortress of the Old World, and the Forest Guards plan to link it with the new lighthouse via city walls, creating a solid defense.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: The red iron door slowly opens with a deep, echoing creak. Cold wind and the scent of snow rush in.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: The blue iron door slowly opens with a deep, echoing creak. Cold wind and the scent of snow rush in.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

RoleContent: More mechanoid guards... This fortress sure is heavily fortified.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: The guards have been idle for a long time, but when they hear the footsteps of the intruders, they draw their blades, ready to fulfill their duty.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

RoleContent: Let's be careful. This will be a difficult battle.
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: The guards have been idle for a long time, but when they hear the footsteps of the intruders, they draw their blades, ready to fulfill their duty.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Fortress Mechanoid Guard
Desc: The guards have been idle for a long time, but when they hear the footsteps of the intruders, they draw their blades, ready to fulfill their duty.
UnOpenDesc: Guardians of the Old World are waiting for your arrival.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Pale Corrupted
Desc: A pale figure rises slowly from the Ice Sea. Her beautiful face is twisted with hatred and fury, \n\nas if cursing the entire world. She walks over the black waters toward the crowd.
UnOpenDesc: A pale figure rises slowly from beneath the sea.

RoleContent: From the time we were driven out of our homeland and began our migration, to lighting the first campfire here, we've spent countless nights with New Sophiasburgh, this new city of ideals.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: After burying the unidentified Corrupted, Antonov gathers the key members of the Border Commune for a quick yet important meeting in New Sophiasburgh.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: But now, the fear of intruders, the desire to conquer this desolate land, and the hatred for the Narwhals are silently creeping up on us. We may once again fall into conflict and turmoil.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: The meeting continues to have a solemn mood.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: To protect this hard-earned land we all call home, I hope everyone present at this meeting will contribute your wisdom and insights.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: Everyone anxiously waits for his next words.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: Please think carefully and write down suggestions that will help improve this city of ideals.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: The future that emerges in your mind while you stare at the blank sheet of paper is...
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: Thank you all for your valuable contribution. New Sophiasburgh is our home, and every inhabitant in it a treasure. As long as our will remains united, this city will stand strong.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: Carefully write down your thoughts on the issue, and place the letter into the feedback box.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: Thank you all for your valuable contribution. New Sophiasburgh is our home, and every inhabitant in it a treasure. As long as our will remains united, this city will stand strong.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: Carefully write down your thoughts on the issue, and place the letter into the feedback box.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

RoleContent: Thank you all for your valuable contribution. New Sophiasburgh is our home, and every inhabitant in it a treasure. As long as our will remains united, this city will stand strong.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: The Future of the City
Desc: Carefully write down your thoughts on the issue, and place the letter into the feedback box.
UnOpenDesc: An important meeting is being held in the city.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: The debate regarding the Narwhals continue. However, with no solution, the Border Commune finally decides to close the port for safety, and relocate the fishermen back into the city.\n\nTo manage the energy costs for the influx of residents into the city, the border commune announces the construction of a massive underground energy center to power the city's residential areas.
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: The grand plan captures everyone's attention. They quickly forget past conflicts with the Narwhals and turn to focus on the more pressing question: \n\nwho will be first to secure housing in the residential areas?
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

RoleContent: Don't hold back—take them all out.
ConfirmContent: Head Out to Eliminate the Corrupted
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: The patrol team answers a distress call from the construction crew and finds the underground power generator surrounded by a few small Corrupted.
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: After clearing the area, the team finds the generator's two <color=#FF5826>substations</color> offline and taken over by the Corrupted. Prioritize these <color=#FF5826>substations</color>. They are located to the <color=#FF5826>west</color> and <color=#FF5826>south</color> of the generator.
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

RoleContent: Tsk, the Corrupted have made it in here too.
ConfirmContent: Head Out to Eliminate the Corrupted
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: Once the substations are online, the power center resumes activity, but noise from the construction draws Corrupted from the nearby tundra.
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

RoleContent: (Weeping)
Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: They roam the wilds alone but instinctively swarm together when they sense humans and destroy every building they come across.
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

Name: Encounter
Title: Encounter
TitleContent: Group of Corrupted
Desc: Oh, I'm sorry, but visitors aren't welcome here. Now get the hell out of my house!
UnOpenDesc: A large number of Corrupted appear underground.

RoleContent: The frontline camp's heating system is nearly complete. Now you must decide whether to request support from the Border Commune or continue building independently. Consider carefully before deciding.
Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: Abandoned cargo ships line the old port, their once-mighty engines \n\nsilenced by time. Stripped for parts, their remains now serve as building materials for makeshift shelters.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: The Border Commune receives news of the completed heating system at the frontline camp. The members express both surprise and gratitude.\n\nHowever, blocked roads and food shortages prevent large-scale reinforcements, so instead, elite agents are dispatched to deliver vital supplies to the camp.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: The group decides to continue building the frontline base. This quick decision speeds up construction.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: Hearing of abundant wildlife near the frontline camp, the commune members thank the team for the valuable information on potential food source.\n\nThey send reinforcements, and with a steady food supply, construction speeds up.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: Bionics roam the snowy forests near the camp, having claimed the area as their new home.\n\nTo minimize conflicts, the patrol team sets clear boundaries for human activity.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Pioneer
Title: Pioneer
TitleContent: Port Area
Desc: Under effective command, the first members to arrive at the tundra from icebreakers settle into cabins built by the Forest Guards.\n\nBut with dwindling energy supplies and the frigid weather, securing fuel and building materials is the next priority.
UnOpenDesc: Moses-Class Icebreaker is docked here.

Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The supplies brought by the ship are almost gone. To build new cabins, the team asks the Forest Guards, who are used to the snow, to gather materials and fuel.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: Ancient snow pines nearby offer sturdy beams for construction. Indigenous traditions says only easily movable deadwood may be logged, but this approach is less efficient.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: Mmm... this amazing smell... It's been a while...
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The Forest Guards bring in old pines, filling the air with a comforting scent. Many polar natives grew up in cabins made of the same wood.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: Same here. It's so comforting.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: In this harsh cold, as the blizzards rage, people dream about nights in their childhood warmed by pine cabins and firelight.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: I didn't think you had lived in a cabin made of old pine like me. Looks like we share similar childhoods. Tell me your story the next time we gather by the stove.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: In this harsh cold, as the blizzards rage, people dream about nights in their childhood warmed by pine cabins and firelight.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: The campfires remind me of my childhood. My father never allowed me to take part in the night watch. He said it was the adults' duty, and children should sleep soundly until dawn.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The Forest Guards bring stacks of brittle, frozen twigs, ideal fuel for the fires. On countless winter nights in the polar cold, they also huddled like this around roaring campfires, seeking warmth.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: What about now?
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The Forest Guards bring stacks of brittle, frozen twigs, ideal fuel for the fires. On countless winter nights in the polar cold, they also huddled like this around roaring campfires, seeking warmth.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: Now? As you can see, before I realized, I'm suddenly the one who must guard others' dreams.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The Forest Guards bring stacks of brittle, frozen twigs, ideal fuel for the fires. On countless winter nights in the polar cold, they also huddled like this around roaring campfires, seeking warmth.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: They're still in good condition—looks like their past owners took great care of them. Thanks so much. Hmm? The engraving on the handle... could it be...?
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: During land clearing, they notice a loose piece of earth as they pass by a shallow snowbank, as though it has been developed before.\n\nThey dig through the thin snow and discover an old toolbox hidden beneath.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: I see... Rosetta, when we leave this frozen tundra behind, let's also leave some tools for those who come after us.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: Tatyana looks carefully at the carving on the axe handle—it is a crest of an ancient family and the words: For those who come after.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

RoleContent: I thought so, too.
Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: Tatyana looks carefully at the carving on the axe handle—it is a crest of an ancient family and the words: For those who come after.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc: The logs are for building beams and for firewood. As night falls, the scent of pine and venison stew urge the workers to return to camp to enjoy their meal.\n\nThe campfires on the front line light up one by one, symbolizing safe return. The flickering flames chase away the biting cold and warm the bodies and hearts once sealed by this frozen land.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

Name: Build
Title: Build
TitleContent: Forest Camp
Desc:
As the camp expands, people start to uncover the ruins buried beneath the tundra.

Machines infected by the Punishing still roam the old towns of a forgotten age, 

mercilessly slaughtering any travelers who stumble into this forsaken city.
UnOpenDesc: Forest Guards are setting up a makeshift camp.

Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: Rumors of New Sophiasburgh's construction progress spread through the Border Commune.\n\nAt first, people arrive with skepticism, but many decide to stay after realizing life here is easier and join in building the new city.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: Many fishermen, tired of the Narwhal' constant disturbance, say they will quit fishing and find other work if no one steps in. Their discontent attitude has already led to a decrease in fish catch lately.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: The increasing population was supposed to be good for the city, but as more people with different views arrive, the city will soon be divided over how to assign work.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: Anyway... this problem is becoming serious, and we need to take a stand. Tatyana, how do you think we should handle this?
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: Tatyana's previous investigation showed that the Narwhal only occasionally interrupts the fishermen's work, \n\nbut many newcomers believe the superstition that "Narwhals bring bad luck." Along with other outside factors, the catch has declined sharply.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: I'll explain the situation to them. Don't worry, the idea that Narwhals bring bad luck is just a silly rumor. Once we explain things carefully, they should understand.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: To calm the fishermen, Tatyana has to make a decision.\n\nSuddenly, an incident from the past that seems unrelated pops into her mind.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: It's true that the Narwhals that roam the Ice Sea outside the city do disturb their fishing. Although it is likely that they don't actually believe the rumor and are just angry at the Narwhals.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: If the Bionic Polar Bear attacked the warehouse from instinct, could the Narwhals be circling the Ice Sea for the same reason?\n\nBut this idea lacks any poof, so Tatyana dismisses it as a fleeting, ungrounded guess.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc:
The fishermen have calmed down thanks to the Logistics Team, but they still want the Border Commune to quickly stop Narwhals from interfering with their fishing boats.

Meanwhile, a few polar aboriginal elders claim Narwhals are guardians of the Ice Sea and warn that driving them away will bring divine wrath.

It looks like the conflict between the two groups is likely to flare up again soon.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: I don't believe those old rumors either... but let's still respond that we will deal with it as soon as possible to calm them down.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc: Tatyana has to make a decision to ease people's worries.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: As Antonov said, most people probably don't truly believe the rumor but are striking to test our stance and see our response.
Name: Decision
Title: Decision
TitleContent: Fishermen's request
Desc:
Suddenly, an incident from the past that seems unrelated pops into her mind.

If the Bionic Polar Bear attacked the warehouse from instinct, could the Narwhals be circling the Ice Sea for the same reason?

But this idea lacks any poof, so Tatyana dismisses it as a fleeting, ungrounded guess.
UnOpenDesc: News of the dwindling fish catch spreads through the city.

RoleContent: Sending more people on the hunt would be more efficient, but given the recent attack by the Corrupted, some need to stay behind for defense.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: With supplies from the ship running low and the camp growing, Forest Guards propose periodic and controlled hunting in the forest to maintain food supply.\n\n
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The tundra hunt is a success, and everyone returns with abundant game. Now, there's ample meat to satisfy hunger and warm furs to make the harsh winter nights feel a little more bearable.\n\nUnfortunately, the defenses set up against the Corrupted only slowed bionic animals. They still made it into the warehouse and ran off with a significant amount of food.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: They took only what they needed and left, indicating that bionic animals aren't mindless like the Corrupted.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The size of the footprints indicates the attacker was probably a Bionic Polar Bear.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: I heard that bionics mimic real animal behavior, so I tried scaring it off the same way we would scare off a polar bear. I got a few people to shout at them.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The group kills a few rabbits and deer that's enough to last them a few weeks.\n\nUpon returning, they discover the base was attacked by a bionic polar bear while they were gone.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: I was surprised it actually worked. The bionic bears are just like real polar bears and fled at the sound of our threats.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The old trick actually worked.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The day before the hunt, they installed electrified wire mesh and an alarm system at the base gate.\n\nSure enough, halfway through the hunt, they got a warning of unusual activity near the warehouse.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: The warehouse is mostly unharmed because the intruders fled after touching the electric fence. This suggests they're not the mindless Corrupted, but creatures that can feel pain and avoid danger.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: Rosetta and a few Forest Guards head back to check on the warehouse, while the others will return later with their spoils after the hunt.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: Even with the low Punishing concentration, the polar region cannot support so many large animals, so I think the attackers are probably highly intelligent bionics that mimic real animal behavior.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: Rosetta thinks for a while before reaching a reasonable conclusion.

RoleContent: This is odd. I thought bionics don't need to eat, so why are they stealing food?
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: After checking the tracks left by the intruder carefully, everyone agrees that the bionics were after the food.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: It might be their instinct. We've met talking bionic machines that told us acting against real animal instincts causes program errors.
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: The experienced Forest Guards recall meeting many talking bionics who \n\nadmitted they must follow the instincts of real creatures, like sunbathing and building nests.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

RoleContent: So our hard-earned food is just a casualty of their animal instinct? This is absurd. Who exactly programmed this...?
Name: Preparation
Title: Preparation
TitleContent: Enemy Invasion
Desc: Everyone has theories on why the bionic animals spent so much energy to steal food they won't eat, but \n\nin the end, the group concludes that it's just "bad luck".
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

Name: Nameless Murder
Title: Nameless Murder
Desc:
A member reports a ruthless, unnamed attacker in the snowy forest, 

threatening the safety of passersby.

The patrol team heads to the reported location to investigate the threat.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

Name: Root Out the Problem
Title: Root Out the Problem
Desc: To expand usable areas for New Sophiasburgh, the patrol team decides to clear the remaining Corrupted in the ruined city.
UnOpenDesc: Ambush

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: The heavy pressure suddenly lifts, as if a shackle has been suddenly released. \n\nTatyana feels a sharp pain in her palm and sees the mysterious ring shattered into pieces. Only then does she realize her clenched fist is bleeding from the shards.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: The group searches for the mysterious knight but finds only an ancient legend carved near the icy lake:\n\n"Chernobog will tempt travelers—wealth to the poor and swords to the weak. The faint-hearted shall self-destruct, and only the brave and honest can overcome temptation and achieve victory."
UnOpenDesc: My precious!

RoleContent: So the one we've been meeting with is...? How could it be...?
Name: Ring of Supremacy
Title: Ring of Supremacy
Desc: Before she can figure it out, the lingering echo of the myth fades in the wind, but their journey is far from over.
UnOpenDesc: My precious!
